extendedIngredients.name: sea-salt
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 tsp. sea salt; more to taste

title: Roasted Beets With White Balsamic & Citrus Dressing
summary: Roasted Beets With White Balsamic & Citrus Dressing is a caveman, gluten free, primal, and whole 30 side dish. This recipe makes 4 servings with 98 calories, 1g of protein, and 7g of fat each. For 50 cents per serving, this recipe covers 4% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Head to the store and pick up beets, sea salt; more, lemon juice, and a few other things to make it today. This recipe is liked by 86 foodies and cooks. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 46%, this dish is good. Similar recipes are Winter Salad with Roasted Beets and Citrus Reduction Dressing, Pasta Salad with Roasted Red Peppers and Basil with White Balsamic Dressing, and Beets and Citrus Arugula Salad & Dressing.
instructions: Position a rack in the center of the oven and heat the oven to 450F. Trim, peel, and cut the beets into 1-inch wedges. Discard the greens or save for another use. Put the beets in a shallow 9x13-inch (or similar) baking dish, toss them with the olive oil and salt until thoroughly coated, and then arrange them in a single layer. Roast the beets, stirring after 20 minutes, until tender when pierced with a fork or skewer and lightly browned on the edges, 30 to 40 minutes.    Meanwhile, whisk the orange juice, vinegar, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a small bowl until the salt is dissolved.    Remove the beets from the oven and while theyre still hot, drizzle the dressing over them, tossing to coat. Let the beets cool to room temperature to meld the flavors. Taste and add more salt, if necessary. Serve at room temperature or gently warmed, topped with the chives, if using.                  nutrition information (per serving):        Calories                        (kcal):                      90, Fat                        (kcal):                      7, Fat Calories                        (g):                      60, Saturated Fat                        (g):                      1, Protein                        (g):                      1, Monounsaturated Fat                        (g):                      5, Carbohydrates                        (mg):                      8, Polyunsaturated Fat                        (mg):                      1, Sodium                        (g):                      260, Cholesterol                        (g):                      0, Fiber                        (g):                      1,                     Photo: Scott Phillips          Rate this Recipe and View Reviews

steps.step: Position a rack in the center of the oven and heat the oven to 450F. Trim, peel, and cut the beets into 1-inch wedges. Discard the greens or save for another use.

Put the beets in a shallow 9x13-inch (or similar) baking dish, toss them with the olive oil and salt until thoroughly coated, and then arrange them in a single layer. Roast the beets, stirring after 20 minutes, until tender when pierced with a fork or skewer and lightly browned on the edges, 30 to 40 minutes.    Meanwhile, whisk the orange juice, vinegar, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a small bowl until the salt is dissolved.
Remove the beets from the oven and while theyre still hot, drizzle the dressing over them, tossing to coat.
Let the beets cool to room temperature to meld the flavors. Taste and add more salt, if necessary.
Serve at room temperature or gently warmed, topped with the chives, if using.
